intro: Sarcosiphon croceus, commonly known as the golden sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant yellow flowers. The plant thrives in coastal areas and sandy soils, often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Its flowers are typically clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences, adding to its ornamental appeal. Sarcosiphon croceus is well adapted to arid conditions, with thick leaves that store water and reduce transpiration.
